summary:
This mod completely revamps the way you retrieve arrows and bolts.

Now, arrows do not randomly disappear off the corpse but rather have a chance of breaking. Also, an automatic retrieval system for arrows in your proximity has been implemented.

Every arrow are recognized by the mod and are completely customizable.
descriptionHtml:
[font=verdana,sans-serif]
[center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/logo.png[/img][/center]
[b]Author :[/b] Seb263
[b]Current Version :[/b] 1.0.2 ([i]03/29/2014[/i])
[size=3][color=#33cc00]If you like this mod, don't forget to support it![/color][/size]


[center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/introduction.png[/img][/center]
As its name would indicate, [u]Arrow Recovery System Overhaul (A.R.S.O)[/u] [b]completely revamps the way you retrieve arrows and bolts[/b].

When hitting a target, [b]arrows do not randomly disappear off the corpse but rather have a chance of breaking[/b].
When missing a target, [b]loose arrows also have a chance of being broken once you retrieve them[/b].

The chances of an arrow breaking (whether they hit or miss) are [b]not calculated by one simple value[/b].
Instead, [b]the resistance of each arrow type is automatically calculated[/b] and is [b]totally configurable[/b] via the mod menu (for each type of arrow).

[b]Once you retrieve a broken arrow, you have 2 options:[/b]
- Chop wood so as to re-craft the arrow with the pieces you have picked up.
- Resell the broken pieces for half the price of the original, intact, arrow.

If your budget is tight or you wish to forge your own arrows, know that the [b]merchants can sell you pieces of each type of arrow[/b].
This brings you the satisfaction of having crafted your own arrows as well as [b]leveling up your smithing skill[/b].
Be warned however, certain arrows cannot be repaired if you do not have the smithing perk to go with it. (i.e Dwarven Arrow : Dwarven Smithing)

In addition to this, [b]an automatic retrieval system for arrows in your proximity has been implemented[/b]:
Once you retrieve an arrow (whatever it may be), [b]you will automatically retrieve all the other arrows[/b] in a radius which you can configure.
You may choose to retrieve all types of arrows, or only the ones matching the first one you manually retrieved.
It is also possible to [b]include NPC corpses[/b] in the radius search.

[b]Every arrow[/b] from the base game, DLCs, and even mods (of all types) are recognized by the mod and are [b]completely customizable[/b].

So as to simply configure the mod, it is heavily recommended (though not required) to use [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3863]SkyUI[/url] so as to have access to the MCM.
If you don't have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3863]SkyUI[/url], a classic menu containing the same options, minus arrow customization, is available via the "powers" menu.

[center][youtube]tJJYpbWA1Q4[/youtube] [youtube]0CZft8CUuVo[/youtube]

[url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/gems.png[/img][/url]


[img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/prerequisites.png[/img]

[color=#cc3333][b]Installing [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE)[/url] version 1.6.12 or above is [u]NECESSARY[/u] for this mod.[/b][/color]


[img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/important-notes.png[/img]

[b]This mod modifies [u]NOTHING[/u] about the vanilla arrows and is thus compatible with [u]EVERY[/u] other mod.[/b]


[img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/translations.png[/img][/center]
[b][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/_shared/localization-flags/fr.gif[/img] A [u]French[/u] version of the mod translated by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/825950/?]myself[/url] is available [url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/skyrim/mods/jouabilite/arrow_recovery_system_overhaul.php]here[/url].[/b]
[b][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/_shared/localization-flags/de.gif[/img] A [u]German[/u] version of the mod translated by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/27122/?]NewRaven[/url] is available [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51864/?]here[/url].[/b]
[b][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/_shared/localization-flags/ru.gif[/img] A [u]Russian[/u] version of the mod translated by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2294578/?]KoVaLR[/url] is available [url=http://tes-game.ru/load/skyrim/gejmplej/5530/47-1-0-7314]here[/url].[/b]
[b][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/_shared/localization-flags/it.gif[/img] A [u]Italian[/u] version of the mod translated by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4621001/?]MaximilianPs[/url] is available [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51955/?]here[/url].[/b]
[b][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/_shared/localization-flags/pl.gif[/img] A [u]Polish[/u] version of the mod translated by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3316649/?]LordTorus[/url] is available [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53349/?]here[/url].[/b]


[center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/faq.png[/img][/center]
[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] It says to install [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE)[/url], how do I do that?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] You may [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]download SKSE here[/url], [url=http://youtu.be/nuFvhYv110g]here is also a video[/url] explaining how to install it.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] Does this mod work with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3863]SkyUI[/url]? If so, is it mandatory?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] The mod is compatible, however it is not mandatory.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] Will this work in conjunction with the [xxx] mod?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] This mod has been designed so as to not change anything to the vanilla game.
Therefore, there is no risk of conflict with another mods.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] Is this mod compatible with mods adding/modifying arrows & bolts?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] As said above, [u]A.R.S.O[/u] does not modify or add arrows and is thus compatible with every other mod.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] All of the arrows in my game aren't available in the mod parameters, what should I do?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] You must equip or have in your inventory each type of non-vanilla arrow at least once for it to be recognized by [u]A.R.S.O[/u].

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] Proximity arrow retrieval takes a long time, what should I do?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] If you have checked the option "Retrieve arrows off corpses", try unchecking it.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] The arrows of a mod that I wish to uninstall are now part of the [u]A.R.S.O[/u] parameters, will this cause a problem with my game?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] [u]A.R.S.O[/u] automatically updates its parameters if it notices a change in mod files, no problems should be had.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] I wish to uninstall [u]A.R.S.O[/u], will this create errors in my save file?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] You may uninstall [u]A.R.S.O[/u] without fear of damaging your save file.

[b][color=#cc3333]Question:[/color][/b] What about the load order?
[b][color=#33cc00]Answer:[/color][/b] You can put [u]A.R.S.O[/u] where you want in your list, it does not matter at all.


[center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/installation.png[/img][/center]
[b]Automatic Installation :[/b]
It is recommended to use the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/]Nexus Mod Manager[/url] to easily install the mod and keep it up to date.

[b]Manual Installation :[/b]
1. Download the latest version of [u]Arrow Recovery System Overhaul[/u].
2. Open the archive using [url=http://www.7-zip.org]7zip[/url] or [url=http://www.win-rar.com]Winrar[/url].
3. Put [b]"ArrowRecoverySystemOverhaul.esp"[/b] and [b]"ArrowRecoverySystemOverhaul.bsa"[/b] in the [b]"Data"[/b] folder of the game.
(Default: C:Program FilesSteamSteamappscommonSkyrimData)
4. Launch the Skyrim launcher and click on [b]"Data Files"[/b].
5. Check the box next to [b]"ArrowRecoverySystemOverhaul.esp"[/b].
[/font]

[font=verdana,sans-serif][center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/credits.png[/img][/center]
Thanks to [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?showuser=1709101]bbe[/url] for his support and a full translation of the mod (French to English).
Thanks to [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?showuser=972816]sagittarius22[/url] for his advice and opinions on the mod.
Beta Testers: Thanks to [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?showuser=1709101]bbe[/url] and Lenox.
Thanks to Bethesda for the great Elder Scrolls series.


[center][img]http://seb263.fr/mods/arrow-recovery-system-overhaul/nexus/images/legal-mentions.png[/img][/center]
This mod may not be published or modified without my permission.[/font]

files.name: Arrow Recovery System Overhaul - Version 1-0-1
files.fileName: Arrow Recovery System Overhaul - Latest Version-51149-1-0-1.zip
files.changelogHtml:
The "Hunter's Discipline" perk is now taken into account by the mod.
You will recover twice as many arrows from dead bodies if you have this perk.

You will recover twice as many arrows from dead bodies if you have this perk.

files.name: Arrow Recovery System Overhaul - Latest Version
files.fileName: Arrow Recovery System Overhaul - Latest Version-51149-1-0-2.zip
files.changelogHtml:
Arrows used by some NPCs will no more be destroyed after their death.
Arrows fired on NPCs will instantly break rather than after their death.
Arrow general resistance can now be set between -100% and 100%.
The disappearance of arrows on some animals has been fixed.

Arrows fired on NPCs will instantly break rather than after their death.

The disappearance of arrows on some animals has been fixed.
